guild.name: AskRuqqus

post.title: How do you think we will die out?

body:
I think it's a race between how long it takes for the earth to be destroyed such as by meteor or by the sun burning out and how long it take for people to colonize other planets and build large scale star ships.

If we get to the point of colonizing other planets then the only thing that is likely to wipe out humanity would be a much more advanced alien race.
body_html:
I think it's a race between how long it takes for the earth to be destroyed such as by meteor or by the sun burning out and how long it take for people to colonize other planets and build large scale star ships.

If we get to the point of colonizing other planets then the only thing that is likely to wipe out humanity would be a much more advanced alien race.

post.title: How do you think we will die out?

body: Other answers are big and existential.  I thought you were asking about this board.  Dur.  To that, my answer is being overrun with content that appeals to only a few users, and people leave out of disinterest.

post.title: How do you think we will die out?

body: It's hard to think of a scenario where humanity is completely wiped out. No matter the calamity, there will always be some group of humans in some remote corner of the world that will likely survive. Afghanistan is a good example. If there was an EMP attack that destroyed all the electronics in the world, 95% of Americans would likely die within a decade. But those remote goat herders in the mountains of Afghanistan? They might not even notice.
body_html: It's hard to think of a scenario where humanity is completely wiped out. No matter the calamity, there will always be some group of humans in some remote corner of the world that will likely survive. Afghanistan is a good example. If there was an EMP attack that destroyed all the electronics in the world, 95% of Americans would likely die within a decade. But those remote goat herders in the mountains of Afghanistan? They might not even notice.

post.title: How do you think we will die out?

body:
Most of the species will kill each other off due to Water Wars and climate change forcing mass migrations north. 

The remaining survivors will likely live for a few centuries till human nature causes them to kill each other over other stupid shit, likely using nukes.

I doubt humanity will ever make it off this planet aside from a few wealthy people.
body_html:
Most of the species will kill each other off due to Water Wars and climate change forcing mass migrations north.

The remaining survivors will likely live for a few centuries till human nature causes them to kill each other over other stupid shit, likely using nukes.

I doubt humanity will ever make it off this planet aside from a few wealthy people.

post.title: How do you think we will die out?

body: Im not sure. There will be a night when there are no dreams. We will gasp for air, but the air wont come. We choke and grab hold anything near us tightly so tight because we know this is the point. This is the point the roller coaster goes over that hill. We can only pray this night is not that night. But dont ever forget, that hill is just on the horizon and one day we will walk that mighty hill.
body_html: Im not sure. There will be a night when there are no dreams. We will gasp for air, but the air wont come. We choke and grab hold anything near us tightly so tight because we know this is the point. This is the point the roller coaster goes over that hill. We can only pray this night is not that night. But dont ever forget, that hill is just on the horizon and one day we will walk that mighty hill.

post.title: How do you think we will die out?

body:
I know we'll probably kick ourselves back to the stone age by climate change, after that I don't know. We won't have the capacity to cause climate change anymore and over the next few centuries, temperatures might return to pre-industrial levels.

It's possible humanity will make a comeback after that, hopefully with a bit more climate awareness than before, but you and I know if that happens, it's just going to repeat itself forever.

I think it's unlikely that a disease will truly wipe us out. The only thing that could really eradicate humans is a huge asteroid, or nuclear war, but we'd have to be *really* thorough, because there's plenty of people living in areas that really aren't worth blowing up for any reason.

Humanity is way too persistent to just die out.
body_html:
I know we'll probably kick ourselves back to the stone age by climate change, after that I don't know. We won't have the capacity to cause climate change anymore and over the next few centuries, temperatures might return to pre-industrial levels.

It's possible humanity will make a comeback after that, hopefully with a bit more climate awareness than before, but you and I know if that happens, it's just going to repeat itself forever.

I think it's unlikely that a disease will truly wipe us out. The only thing that could really eradicate humans is a huge asteroid, or nuclear war, but we'd have to be really thorough, because there's plenty of people living in areas that really aren't worth blowing up for any reason.

Humanity is way too persistent to just die out.
